title: Anaconda3, Ubuntu 16.04 Python 3.6 Caffe2 installation issue
body_html:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • OS:Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version:
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): PyTorch not installed in this environment at this time
  • Python version:3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version:9.0/7.0
  • GPU models and configuration: GeForce 1050Ti
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):5.4
  • CMake version:3.9.0-rc5
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Native Python in Ubuntu 16.04 is Python2 (2.7) and Python3 (3.5)

  1. Anaconda3 installed (Version4.5.0)
  2. Created an environment conda create --name caffe36 python==3.6
  3. source activate caffe36
  4. conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7

Now python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure"

result is Failure

More details from CLI:
CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: No module named 'caffe2.python.caffe2_pybind11_state'

I see that caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so and also caffe2_pybind11_state_gpu.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so exists in ~/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python

What do I need to do so that caffe2.python gets loaded (module 'caffe2.python.caffe2_pybind11_state' is found)

Some guidance is needed in documentation

Update
If I add

  1. import sys
  2. sys.path.append('/home/sam/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python')
  3. from caffe2.python import core

I get an error

CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: /home/sam/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python/caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: _ZN6google15SetUsageMessageERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEE

import sys

I get an error

body:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines
--------------------------------

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):
- PyTorch or Caffe2: **Caffe2**
- OS:**Ubuntu 16.04**
- PyTorch version:
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): PyTorch not installed in this environment at this time
- Python version:**3.6**
- CUDA/cuDNN version:**9.0/7.0**
- GPU models and configuration: **GeForce 1050Ti**
- GCC version (if compiling from source):**5.4**
- CMake version:**3.9.0-rc5**
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Native Python in Ubuntu 16.04 is Python2 (2.7) and Python3 (3.5)

1. Anaconda3 installed (Version4.5.0)
2. Created an environment **conda create --name caffe36 python==3.6**
3. source activate caffe36
4. conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7

Now **python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure"**

result is **Failure**

More details from CLI:
CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: No module named 'caffe2.python.caffe2_pybind11_state'

I see that **caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so** and also **caffe2_pybind11_state_gpu.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so** exists in ~/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python

What do I need to do so that caffe2.python gets loaded (module 'caffe2.python.caffe2_pybind11_state' is found)

Some guidance is needed in documentation

**Update**
If I add 

1. import sys
2. sys.path.append('/home/sam/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python')
3. from caffe2.python import core

I get an error 

CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: /home/sam/anaconda3/envs/caffe36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg/caffe2/python/caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so: undefined symbol: _ZN6google15SetUsageMessageERKNSt7__cxx1112basic_stringIcSt11char_traitsIcESaIcEEE
